description.narrative: (a) Employment creation: The farm will employ 40 permanent workers while during the harvest period (2 months), it will require 400 additional casual workers. (b) Market access and shared prosperity: WM will provide access to market and fair pricing to hundreds of litchi, mango and avocado growers in Central Mozambique and Zimbabwe (neighbouring Chipinge growing region). (c) Knowledge transfer: WM will provide access to training, inputs and appropriate planting material to smallholders and emerging commercial farmers. (d) SME supply chain development: WM will hire local contractors (logistics, earth moving, equipment & chemicals suppliers and the like). (e) Community Development benefits: WM will set up social infrastructures (local clinic, roads¦) and will partner with local NGOs to improve the well-being of the community. (f) Replicability/Demonstration effect: WM sees a lot of potential for expansion in Mozambique and in the medium term in Zimbabwe. WM also hopes to attract other South African avocado and fruit growers by demonstrating Manica''s suitability for agriculture investments.

Westfalia Fruto Mocambique Ltda (WM or the Company), a local subsidiary of Westfalia Limited, the leading South African avocado producer, plans to establish a 200 hectare avocado farm near the city of Chimoio in Central Mozambique (the "Project"). The Company will also build a packhouse to handle own production and that of the local fruit growers (avocados, litchis, mangoes) for the export market. WM will support local small farmers and emerging commercial growers in improving their fruit production through provision of training and technical assistance; and ensuring their access to markets through Westfalia''s established networks.
